Using this card, generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?
Please tell me on a score of 0 to 10, where 0 means you can't be too careful and 10 means that most people can be trusted.

Most people would try to take advantage of me
Most people would try to be fair

Now we want to ask you a few questions about politics and government
How interested would you say you are in politics – are you...
How often does politics seem so complicated that you can't really understand what is going on?
How difficult or easy do you find it to make your mind up about political issues?
Using this card, please tell me on a score of 0-10 how much you personally trust each of the institutions I read out.
0 means you do not trust the institution at all, and 10 means you have complete trust.
Some people don't vote nowadays for one reason or another.
Did you vote in the last Irish national election in month/year?
Which party did you vote for in that election?
There are different ways of trying to improve things in Ireland or help prevent things from going wrong.
During the last 12 months, have you done any of the following?

Worked in another organisation or association?
Worn or displayed a campaign badge/ sticker?
Taken part in a lawful public demonstration?

How close do you feel to this party?
Do you feel that you are...
Are you a member of any political party?

Using this card, where would you place yourself on this scale, where ‘0' means the left and ‘10' means the right?
All things considered, how satisfied are you with your life as a whole nowadays?
Please answer using this card, where 0 means extremely dissatisfied and 10 means extremely satisfied.
On the whole how satisfied are you with the present state of the economy in Ireland?
Now thinking about the Irish government, how satisfied are you with the way it is doing its job?
And on the whole, how satisfied are you with the way democracy works in Ireland?
Now, using this card, please say what you think overall about the state of education in Ireland nowadays?
Still using this card, please say what you think overall about the state of health services in Ireland nowadays?
Using this card, please say to what extent you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
The government should take measures to reduce differences in income levels.
Gay men and lesbians should be free to live their own life as they wish.
Political parties that wish to overthrow democracy should be banned.
Modern science can be relied on to solve our environmental problems.
Now, thinking about the European Union, some say European unification should go further.
Others say it has already gone too far.
Using this card, what number on the scale best describes your position?
Unification has already gone too far
Now some questions about people from other countries coming to live in Ireland.

Allow many to come and live here

Allow many to come and live here
How about people from the poorer countries outside Europe?
Allow many to come and live here

People have different views on what the responsibilities of governments should or should not be.
For each of the tasks I read out please tell me on a score of 0-10 how much responsibility you think governments should have.
0 means it should not be governments' responsibility at all and 10 means it should be entirely governments' responsibility.
... ensure a job for everyone who wants one?
Should not be governments' responsibility at all
...ensure adequate health care for the sick?
Should not be governments' responsibility at all
...ensure a reasonable standard of living for the old?
Should not be governments' responsibility at all

Should not be governments' responsibility at all

Should not be governments' responsibility at all
I am now going to ask you about the effect of social benefits and services on different areas of life in Ireland.
By social benefits and services we are thinking about things like health care, pensions and social security.
Using this card please tell me to what extent you agree or disagree that social benefits and services in Ireland place too great a strain on the economy?
...encourage people from other countries to come and live here?
...cost businesses too much in taxes and charges?
...make it easier for people to combine work and family life?
And to what extent do you agree or disagree that social benefits and services in Ireland make people lazy?
...make people less willing to care for one another?
...make people less willing to look after themselves and their family?
Still thinking about the provision of social benefits and services, please tell  me how efficient you think the provision of health care in Ireland is.
Choose your  answer from this card where 0 means extremely inefficient and 10 means extremely  efficient.
And how efficient do you think the tax authorities are at things like handling queries on time, avoiding mistakes and preventing fraud?
Please use this card where 0 means they are extremely inefficient in doing their job and 10 means they are extremely efficient.
Using this card, please tell me whether you think doctors and nurses in Ireland give special advantages to certain people or deal with everyone equally?
Choose your answer from this card where 0 means you think they give special advantages to certain people and 10 means you think they deal with everyone equally.
Give special advantages to certain people
And using the same card, please tell me whether you think the tax authorities in Ireland give special advantages to certain people or deal with everyone equally?
Give special advantages to certain people
Many social benefits and services are paid for by taxes.

If the government had to choose between increasing taxes and spending more on social benefits and  services, or decreasing taxes and spending less on social benefits and services, which  should they do?
Choose your answer from this card.
Government should decrease taxes a lot and spend much less on social benefits and services.
Government should increase taxes a lot and spend much more on social benefits and services.
Think of two people, one earning twice as much as the other.
Which of  the three statements on this card comes closest to how you think they should be  taxed?
They should both pay the same share (same %) of their earnings in tax so that the person earning twice as much pays double in tax.
The higher earner should pay a higher share (a higher %) of their earnings in tax so the person earning twice as much pays more than double in tax.
They should both pay the same actual amount of money in tax regardless of their different levels of earnings.
Some people say that higher earners should get larger old age pensions because they have paid in more.
Others say that lower earners should get larger old age pensions because their needs are  greater.
Which of the three statements on this card comes closest  to  your view?
Higher earners should get a larger old age pension  than lower earners.
High and low earners should get the same amount  of old age pension.
Lower earners should get a larger old age pension  than higher earners.

Some people say that higher earners should get more benefit when they are temporarily unemployed because they paid more in tax, whilst others think that lower earners should get more because they are in greater need.
Using this card, please tell me which of the three  statements you agree with most?
Higher earners who become unemployed temporarily  should get more in benefit.
High and low earners should get the same  amount of benefit.
Lower earners who become unemployed temporarily should  get more in benefit.
Thinking of people coming to live in Ireland from other countries, when do you think they should obtain the same rights to social benefits and  services as citizens already living here?
Please choose the option on this card that comes closest to your view.
After living in Ireland for a year, whether or not they have worked.
Only after they have worked and paid taxes for at least a year.
Once they have become an Irish citizen.
They should never get the same rights.
A lot of people who come to live in Ireland from other countries pay taxes and make use of social benefits and services.
On balance, do you think people who come to live in Ireland receive more than they contribute or contribute more than they receive?
Please use this card where 0 means they receive much more and 10 means they contribute much more.
Receive much more than they contribute
Contribute much more than they receive
Using this card, please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements about people in Ireland.
READ OUT EACH STATEMENT AND CODE IN GRID
Most unemployed people do not really try to find a job.
Many people with very low incomes get less benefit than they are legally entitled to.
Many people manage to obtain benefits and services to which they are not entitled.
There are insufficient benefits in Ireland to help the people who are in real need.
Employees often pretend they are sick in order to stay at home.
There is some debate nowadays about the cost of providing public health care in Ireland.
Thinking about 10 years from now, which of the statements on this card comes closest to your own opinion?
Ireland will not be able to afford the present level  of public health care.
Ireland will be able to afford the present level of public  health care but not to increase it.
Ireland will be able to afford to increase the level of public health care.
There is also some debate nowadays about the cost of pensions in Ireland.
Thinking of ten years from now, which of the statements on  this card comes closest to your own opinion?
Ireland will not be able to afford the present level of old age pension.
Ireland will be able to afford the present level of old age pension but not to increase it.
Ireland will be able to afford to increase the level of old age pension.
